interestingFact: Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
The Amazon Rainforest is home to more than 10% of the known species on Earth.
Australia is home to more than 60 different wine regions.
Germany is known for its beer purity law, the Reinheitsgebot, dating back to 1516.
India has the world's largest postal network, with over 150,000 post offices.
South Africa is the only country to have hosted the World Cup, the Rugby World Cup, and the Cricket World Cup.
Mexico City is built on top of an ancient lake and is sinking at a rate of about 10 inches per year.
Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage Sites than any other country.
Russia is the largest country in the world, covering more than one-eighth of Earth's inhabited land area.
